subject: Fix systemd per-connection service
commitMessage:
Fix systemd per-connection service

sshd(8) started on demand with logging via syslog socket
inappropriately sets up file descriptor 0 passed to interactive
shell which makes the shell exit before showing prompt. To fix
the issues sshd needs to log to stderr and the file descriptor
needs to be redirected to systemd journal.

Change-Id: I03a5bf148a5096b0b7ba3a312b3ca8890b1bdd89
Signed-off-by: Łukasz Stelmach <l.stelmach@samsung.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.
Uploaded patch set 2.
Patch Set 2: Verified+1
Patch Set 2: Verified+1 Code-Review+1

Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

lgtm

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

After applying this change I keep getting such error messages every time I log in via ssh:

lastlog_openseek: Couldn't stat /var/log/lastlog: No such file or directory
lastlog_openseek: Couldn't stat /var/log/lastlog: No such file or directory

Can something be done about it?

Patch Set 2:

touch /var/log/lastlog

Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

I meant something that does not give this error in the first place. For example there is --disable-lastlog configure option, but I'm not sure it's a good idea.
Patch Set 2: Verified+1 Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Add pam_smack to the sshd pam module list (PTREL-549)
commitMessage:
Add pam_smack to the sshd pam module list (PTREL-549)

This makes ssh sessions run in the context "User"

Change-Id: I542f9e5689feb18e198af4da4e652b7952059151
Signed-off-by: Michael Leibowitz <michael.leibowitz@intel.com>
